category.motivation: The article reports a new product feature introduced by Google, which is a company news item unrelated to earnings, thus fitting the company_update category.

impact.motivation: The article reports a new feature by Google that could influence consumer behavior and regulatory compliance in audio devices, indicating a moderate impact on Google's product strategy and the broader audio safety market.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports a newly introduced feature for Pixel devices, representing an immediate product update and compliance action.

article_node.title: Like it or not, your Pixel will now lower your headphones' loud audio
article_node.summary: Google is introducing a new Hearing Wellness feature for Pixel devices that will alert users when headphone volume exceeds safe levels, based on recommendations from the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). If users do not respond to the alerts, the feature will automatically lower the volume to prevent potential hearing damage. This feature is part of a broader initiative to comply with updated safety standards, specifically IEC 62368-1, which emphasizes hazard-based safety engineering for audio and ICT equipment.
